title: UK box office report, September 27-29: Fleabag crushes The Goldfinch like a guinea pig
text:
Phoebe Waller-Bridge's stage show is the cinema event of the year, while an all-star Donna Tartt adaptation is as dead as the dodo, writes Charles Gant in his weekly box office bulletin

The miss: The Goldfinch

Back in July 2016, when it was announced that Brooklyn director John Crowley would take the creative reins on the big-screen version of Donna Tartt’s The Goldfinch, expectations were high for what would surely be a classy adaptation of a much-loved novel. A cast including Nicole Kidman, Jeffrey Wright, Luke Wilson and Sarah Paulson in the senior tier of roles, plus Ansel Elgort, Stranger Things’ Finn Wolfhard, Aneurin Barnard and Oakes Fegley, likewise gave encouragement.

More than three...
description: Phoebe Waller-Bridge's stage show is the cinema event of the year, while an all-star Donna Tartt adaptation is as dead as the dodo, writes Charles Gant in his weekly box office bulletin
